item.title: Idées Suspendues
item.description:
Idées Suspendues The thema is the COVID-19 pandemy, and the will to restart in full safety. But we do not want the little economy, what we call the “Real” economy to die due to this virus. The site can be reached at Idées Suspendues and this is the idea behind:
After the stores reopen, we all wonder how restaurants will be able to adapt to the new safety standards to welcome their customers again .

item.title: SaF IT Services
item.description: SaF IT Services web site A little bit over a year ago I founded, together with Fritz and Stefy our company, SaF IT Services. The web site is hosted by Easyhost Belgium and is an extremely simple one, it is based on: HTML CSS Bootstrap JS I have used a free bootstrap template called Freelancer to implement the site, for which the important parameters were : Speed Look (should not be too bad as I am not a designer but I can spot something ugly) Content The site could be further optimized by slimming down the various js files that it imports and of which only a minimal part are used.

item.title: VCARD QR Codes in Inkscape
item.description: A Inkscape plugin to generate VCARD QR Codes. This work is based on a inkscape plugin by Sergey Vedernikov, in turn based on the work of others. My version is a little modification to the plugin that Sergey proposed in a Inkscape forum. I generate a VCARD (the plugin interface is consistent) that contains a field for the website and not the birthday of the contact. In my opinion this is much better to use the plugin to generate QR Codes for business cards.

item.title: Apprenons Python
item.description: Apprenons Python Apprenons Python en jouant is a website I built to keep track of a trip into teaching Python programming to kids. The site started as a way to respond to the innocent question from my son and one of his friends: How do you write a video game. We started this trip a couple of years ago and since then we have explored the world of text based gaming, graphics based gaming, web development, physical computing (with the raspberry pi) etc.

item.title: Data Science day by day
item.description: Data Science day by day Data Science day by day is my Data Science learning blog. In 2015, I started learning about Data Science and ML, being a seasoned IT Professional it did not sound at all new to me. But I wanted to learn and to keep up to date with the most recent developments, I wanted to brush up my stats and maths, I wanted to be current (or as current as I can).

item.title: DS Capstone Project
item.description: Data Science Specialization - Capstone Project This project is the closing chapter of the JHU / Coursera Data Science specialization MOOC. The Capstone project consisted in building an “intelligent keyboard”, that tried to guess the next word based on what you type. It will also detect any bad language and clean it. I took a slightly different approach to all implementations that I have seen, going for a solution where the datagram database is implemented in SQLLite.

item.title: Developing Data Products
item.description: Developing Data Products This is one of the MOOCs of the JHU/Coursera Data Science specialization. It is the course in which you familiarise with producing Data Science products that other people can use to explore the data, as well as producing interactive presentations from R using Rmarkdown. The presentation can be found on Github The little R/Shiny application can be found on shinyapps.io

item.title: The work experience of a lifetime
item.description: SSSB and the SSSB Section The NATO SSSB Program is the place where I have spent most of my professional carrer. And since there is an online presence with a picture of myself on, I would like to mention it here. Among the tasks I was in charge of there: Software Development (initially C then Java) System Analysis Hardware updates Helpdesk Training Test conduct and test support Quality control Project supervision
